thread.title: Liberia: MPW Gears Up for Road Repairs in Dry Season
thread.title_full: Liberia: MPW Gears Up for Road Repairs in Dry Season

title: Liberia: MPW Gears Up for Road Repairs in Dry Season
text:
Liberia: Woman Gives Birth to Siamese Twins, But... By Jeraldine M. Gbaa, Intern 
The Ministry of Public Works is gearing up to rehabilitate roads in Monrovia in the upcoming dry season with Benson Street as top priority, Public Works Communications Director Gregory Stemn has disclosed. 
He told the Liberia News Agency Tuesday that car washers at the intersection of Benson and Buchanan Streets will soon be relocated to pave the way for the upgrade of Benson Street as part of the program. 
Stemn noted that the ministry is collaborating with the Monrovia City Corporation (MCC) to ensure that the car washers are relocated to an unspecified location as soon as possible. 
He indicated that MPW is not in the business of "destroying people's properties" as perceived by the public, but noted that structures that are in the right of way will be removed. Liberia
